response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age (21 years)", "medium", "Young age is associated with a higher likelihood of recidivism compared to older individuals."],
    ["Gender (Male)", "high", "Males statistically show higher rates of recidivism."],
    ["Criminal History (1 arrest, no conviction)", "medium", "A prior arrest may indicate some risk, though lack of conviction suggests lower severity."],
    ["Substance Use (Marijuana and cocaine use)", "high", "Recent drug use is strongly correlated with an increased risk of recidivism."],
    ["Mental Health (Recent depressive feelings)", "medium", "Depression and related mood symptoms can be linked to behavioral issues leading to risk."],
    ["Educational and Employment Status (High school diploma, enrolled in college, 2 jobs)", "low", "Ongoing education and employment history are protective factors against recidivism."],
    ["Family Background (Raised in a stable family with both parents)", "low", "A stable family background is generally associated with lower recidivism risk."],
    ["Social/Spiritual Beliefs (Belief in God)", "low", "Spiritual or religious beliefs may offer protective emotional and social support."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 70
}

risk_factors: Young age is associated with a higher likelihood of recidivism compared to older individuals.
Males statistically show higher rates of recidivism.
A prior arrest may indicate some risk, though lack of conviction suggests lower severity.
Recent drug use is strongly correlated with an increased risk of recidivism.
Depression and related mood symptoms can be linked to behavioral issues leading to risk.
Educational and Employment Status (High school diploma, enrolled in college, 2 jobs)
Ongoing education and employment history are protective factors against recidivism.
Family Background (Raised in a stable family with both parents)
A stable family background is generally associated with lower recidivism risk.
Spiritual or religious beliefs may offer protective emotional and social support.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 21-year-old male who identifies himself as Hispanic. He has been arrested 1 time but has not been convicted. He is 5 feet 5 inches and weighs 145 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is enrolled in a 4-year college. He has held 2 jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana and cocaine) and some of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with both of his biological parents in a household of size 3, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
